title: 'Close Aide Murdered': Mamata Banerjee After TMC Leader Shot Dead In Bengal's Malda - News18
summary:
Mamata Banerjee Grieves the Murder of Close Aide Dulal Sarkar in Malda

Date: January 02, 2025 Source: News18

Trinamool Congress leader Dulal Sarkar was tragically shot dead in Malda district, West Bengal. The incident occurred in broad daylight as he was heading to his factory, leading to a wave of shock and condemnation from party leaders, particularly Mamata Banerjee.

  • Dulal Sarkar, also known as Babla, was shot by assailants on motorcycles in front of witnesses.
  • Mamata Banerjee described him as a close associate and expressed her grief publicly.
  • The incident raised serious concerns about the security oversight in the region, with Banerjee blaming police negligence.
  • Banerjee confirmed that Sarkar’s security cover had been removed prior to the attack.
  • Trinamool leaders are demanding immediate action from the police.
My close associate, and a very popular leader, Babla Sarkar has been murdered today. From the beginning of the Trinamool Congress, he (and his wife Chaitali Sarkar) worked hard for the party. I am sad and hugely shocked after knowing about the incident. The culprits must be booked immediately. — Mamata Banerjee

The tragic event highlights ongoing issues of safety and security for political leaders in the area, sparking calls for reform and immediate investigations.
newTitle: Mamata Banerjee Grieves the Murder of Close Aide Dulal Sarkar in Malda

BPSC protest: Prashant Kishor begins fast unto death demanding exam cancellations - The Times of India
summary:
BPSC Protest: Prashant Kishor Begins Hunger Strike Demanding Exam Cancellations

Publication Date: October 2023 Source: Times of India

Prashant Kishor has initiated a hunger strike in response to the ongoing BPSC exam controversy, demanding the cancellation of specific examinations that he believes are unjust.

  • Kishor's protest aims to bring attention to alleged irregularities in the BPSC examination process.
  • The protest has drawn significant support from students and political allies.
  • Kishor states that the examinations conducted are flawed and seek justice for the candidates.
“No candidate should suffer due to the faults in the examination process,” Prashant Kishor remarked during his protest.

This protest highlights the growing unrest among students regarding similar examination policies and the increasing demand for accountability in education systems.
newTitle: BPSC Protest: Prashant Kishor Begins Hunger Strike Demanding Exam Cancellations

title: Supreme Court Asks UP Govt To Provide Medical & Enquiry Reports On Gangster-Politician Mukhtar Ansari's... - Live Law - Indian Legal News
summary:
Supreme Court Asks UP Govt To Provide Medical & Enquiry Reports On Gangster-Politician Mukhtar Ansari's Death

Publication Date: March 28, 2024

Source: Live Law

The Supreme Court has ordered the Uttar Pradesh government to provide medical and inquiry reports related to Mukhtar Ansari's death to his son, Umar Ansari.

The petition filed by Umar Ansari seeks his father's transfer for safety concerns following his death under suspicious circumstances.

  • The Supreme Court has granted two weeks for the UP government to submit the reports.
  • Umar Ansari alleges his father was poisoned while in custody.
  • Mukhtar Ansari was previously transferred to UP from a Punjab jail due to security concerns.
  • Concerns arise from previous murders of co-accused individuals.

“His family members had been targets of persecution by the State.”

The court’s involvement highlights ongoing concerns regarding the treatment of inmates and political figures within the justice system in Uttar Pradesh.
newTitle: Supreme Court Requests Medical Reports on Mukhtar Ansari's Death

title: Karnataka announces 15% hike in bus fares from January 5 - Deccan Herald
summary:
Karnataka's Bus Fares to Increase by 15% Starting January 5

Published: 02 January 2025, 12:56 IST

The Karnataka government has approved a 15% fare increase for all bus services operated by the state's Road Transport Corporations, effective January 5, 2025.

  • The hike is the first for RTCs since 2020 for KSRTC and other corporations and since 2014 for BMTC.
  • This increase is expected to generate an additional revenue of Rs 74.85 crore for the RTCs.
  • Buses in Karnataka will still have lower ticket prices compared to neighboring states like Andhra Pradesh, Telangana, and Maharashtra.
  • The fare hike meets one of the major demands from RTC employees, who postponed a planned protest due to this decision.
  • The government's expenses on the Shakti scheme, allowing free travel for eligible women, will rise significantly.
This fare hike is essential for maintaining our services and ensuring the sustainability of our operations amidst rising costs.

This decision marks a significant development in Karnataka's public transportation landscape, as it addresses both employee demands and operational costs.
newTitle: Karnataka's Bus Fares to Increase by 15% Starting January 5

title: Karnataka cabinet approves 15% hike in bus fares for four RTCs from January 5 - Moneycontrol
Prashant Kishor announces fast unto death over demand for BPSC exam cancellation - The Indian Express
summary:
Prashant Kishor announces fast unto death over BPSC prelims cancellation demand

Date: January 02, 2025 | Source: The Indian Express

In Patna, Jan Suraaj party founder Prashant Kishor announced a fast unto death to support BPSC aspirants demanding the cancellation of the prelims held last month.

  • Kishor alleges corruption in government job processes.
  • He has demanded fresh exams and action against corrupt officials.
  • Protesters claim issues like non-functional CCTV and late distribution of question papers existed during the exam.
  • Despite protests, the BPSC has only agreed to reschedule one center's exam.
“My demands include cancellation of the exam and holding of fresh tests. I also seek action against corrupt officials.” - Prashant Kishor

The protest highlights the ongoing issues surrounding government recruitment in Bihar and aims to draw attention to the plight of the students involved.
newTitle: Prashant Kishor Begins Hunger Strike Demanding Cancellation of BPSC Prelims

title: 'Most fitting tribute to his legacy': NSUI demands PM Modi rename DU's Veer Savarkar college after Manmoh - The Times of India
summary:
'Most fitting tribute to his legacy': NSUI demands PM Modi rename DU's Veer Savarkar college after Manmohan Singh

Publication Date: October 2023 Source: Times of India

The National Students' Union of India (NSUI) has called for the renaming of Delhi University's Veer Savarkar college after the late Prime Minister Manmohan Singh, citing it as an ideal tribute to his legacy.

  • NSUI emphasizes Singh's contributions to the country and his role in shaping modern India.
  • The proposal is part of a larger movement aimed at recognizing the achievements of former leaders.
  • Critics of Savarkar argue that the change would symbolize a positive shift in historical narrative.
“Manmohan Singh’s tenure was marked by significant economic reforms that transformed India.”

The demand reflects ongoing discussions on how historical figures are represented in educational institutions today.
newTitle: 'Most fitting tribute to his legacy': NSUI demands PM Modi rename DU's Veer Savarkar college after Manmohan Singh

title: Bhojshala Temple-Kamal Maula Mosque Row : Supreme Court Bench Questions Excavation At Site Despite... - Live Law - Indian Legal News
summary:
Supreme Court Reviews Excavation at Bhojshala Temple-Kamal Maula Mosque Complex

Publication Date: Today | Source: Live Law

The Supreme Court has directed the Registry to present a petition challenging the Madhya Pradesh High Court's order for an ASI survey at the contested Bhojshala Temple-Kamal Maula Mosque site, amid concerns over ongoing excavations.

  • The Supreme Court is addressing a petition against the Madhya Pradesh High Court's order which mandates a survey by the ASI.
  • Justice Roy has expressed concerns over excavation activities at the site, which allegedly violate previous orders.
  • Hindus view the Bhojshala as a temple, while Muslims consider it a mosque, leading to community tensions.
  • The court's interim order restricts any excavations that would alter the site's character.
“If you (respondents) want to press on this line...let's take up the contempt matter...” - Justice Roy

This ongoing legal dispute straddles complex religious sentiments and legal interpretations regarding places of worship in India.
newTitle: Supreme Court Reviews Excavation at Bhojshala Temple-Kamal Maula Mosque Complex

title: Need ambulance in 10 minutes? BlinkIt delivers in Gurugram, plans expansion | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
BlinkIt Launches 10-Minute Ambulance Service in Gurugram

Publication Date: January 2, 2025
Source: Live Mint

BlinkIt has introduced a 10-minute ambulance booking service in Gurugram, aiming to provide quick emergency medical assistance and plans to expand to more cities.

Key Points

  • The service includes the launch of five ambulances in Gurugram.
  • Users can book a Basic Life Support (BLS) ambulance via the BlinkIt app.
  • Ambulances will be equipped with essential medical equipment and staffed by a paramedic, an assistant, and a trained driver.
  • CEO Albinder Dhindsa emphasized that the aim is to provide affordable services rather than seeking profit.
  • The company plans to scale the service to major cities within two years.

Notable Quotes

“We are taking our first step towards solving the problem of providing quick and reliable ambulance service in our cities.” — Albinder Dhindsa
“Congratulations Albi! Very well thought-out use case. Expecting it to become fully commercially successful and solve the ambulance issue in many more cities.” — Vijay Shekhar Sharma

BlinkIt's initiative has received positive feedback, although some users expressed concerns about potential surge pricing during high demand.
newTitle: BlinkIt Launches 10-Minute Ambulance Service in Gurugram

Arvind Kejriwal backs protesting farmers: 'Centre planning to implement 3 black laws' - Hindustan Times
summary:
Kejriwal Warns BJP Over Farmers' Protest and Potential Revival of Black Laws

Date: January 02, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) chief Arvind Kejriwal is supporting farmers protesting against the central government's potential plan to reintroduce three controversial farm laws that were withdrawn in 2021. He criticized the BJP for not engaging in dialogue with the farmers.

  • Kejriwal claims BJP is planning to revive the three "black" laws withdrawn after major protests.
  • Farmers demand a legal guarantee for minimum support price (MSP) amidst ongoing protests.
  • Kejriwal warns that the BJP would be responsible if any harm comes to farmer leaders.
  • The central government allegedly plans to implement laws "through the back door" under the guise of new policies.
"If something happens to them, then BJP will be responsible for it," Kejriwal stated.

The ongoing protests and government negotiations surrounding farmers' rights continue to be a significant issue, raising concerns over the future of agricultural policies in India.
newTitle: Kejriwal Warns BJP Over Farmers' Protest and Potential Revival of Black Laws

Bhopal gas tragedy: Toxic waste removed from Union carbide factory after 40 years - BBC.com
summary:
Bhopal gas tragedy: Toxic waste removed from Union carbide factory after 40 years

Publication Date: Not specified
Source: BBC News

Authorities in India have successfully removed hundreds of tonnes of toxic waste from the site of the 1984 Bhopal gas tragedy, where thousands died from a gas leak. The removal follows a court order aimed at addressing the long-standing environmental and health hazards posed by the waste.

  • 337 tonnes of toxic waste transported to an incinerator 230 km away.
  • The waste removal comes 40 years after the gas leak incident that killed thousands.
  • Activists express concern over the health risks of incinerating the waste at the new location.
  • Groundwater near the factory remains contaminated, affecting residential areas.
  • Previous attempts to dispose of the waste faced significant opposition and were abandoned.
  • The Bhopal gas tragedy is recognized as one of the largest industrial disasters globally.
“The 1.1 million tonnes of toxic soil and waste still continues to contaminate the groundwater of hundreds and thousands of people [in Bhopal],” said Rachna Dhingra from the International Campaign for Justice in Bhopal.

The recent waste removal is a critical step but highlights the ongoing challenges related to environmental justice and health for Bhopal’s residents.
newTitle: Bhopal Gas Tragedy: Toxic Waste Cleared After 40 Years

title: 2024 – A Record Donations For Tirumala - Gulte
summary:
2024 - A Record Donations For Tirumala

Published on: 4:50 pm, 2 January 2025

The number of devotees visiting the Tirumala temple has surged in 2024, leading to a record income from the temple's Hundi, amounting to ₹1,365 crore, significantly higher than the previous year.

  • 2.55 crore devotees visited Tirumala for darshan of Lord Venkateswara in 2024.
  • 99 lakh devotees presented hair offerings, a tradition of devotion.
  • 6.3 crore devotees were served the famed “Annaprasadam” (free food).
  • 12.14 crore laddus were sold, highlighting their popularity.
  • The increase in donations may lead to new developments and services at the temple.
“With this record-breaking income, TTD is likely to implement new plans to enhance the participation of devotees and improve services.”

This year's record donations and increase in devotees reflect the growing devotion and participation in the Tirumala temple’s offerings.

Supreme Court Pulls Up Advocate For Alleging Nepotism In Senior Designations For Judges' Relatives, Warns ... - Live Law - Indian Legal News
summary:
Supreme Court Pulls Up Advocate For Alleging Nepotism In Senior Designations For Judges' Relatives, Warns

Date & Source: [Publication Date Unknown], Live Law

The Supreme Court today criticized Advocate Mathews J Nedumpara for suggesting that nepotism is rampant in the designation of senior advocates.

  • The petition challenged senior designations given to 70 advocates by the Delhi High Court.
  • The Supreme Court bench expressed serious concern over the allegations made in the petition.
  • Justice Viswanathan warned of legal actions against the petitioners if the offending statements were not retracted.
  • Some petitioners sought to withdraw their names from the case.
  • Nedumpara expressed concerns about the fear among lawyers regarding judges.
“Even a lawyer who is signatory to such pleadings is equally guilty of contempt.” - Justice Gavai

The matter is set to be revisited after Advocate Nedumpara considers the bench's warnings and possible amendments to the allegations.
newTitle: Supreme Court Takes Action Against Advocate's Allegations of Nepotism in Senior Advocate Designation

summary:
'Rolling out red carpet': Giriraj Singh accuses Mamata govt of turning West Bengal into 'nursery for Bangladeshi infiltrators'

Publication Date: October 2023

Source: Times of India

Giriraj Singh has criticized the Mamata Banerjee government in West Bengal, alleging it has created conditions favorable for illegal infiltration from Bangladesh.

  • Singh asserts that the state government is 'rolling out the red carpet' for infiltrators.
  • The accusations come in the context of a broader political debate on border security.
  • Mamata Banerjee's administration has denied these allegations, citing a commitment to law and order.
“The situation in West Bengal under the current government has become alarming,” Singh stated.

These accusations highlight ongoing tensions related to immigration and security in the region, with significant political ramifications.

title: Nimisha Priya case in Yemen: ‘We will do whatever we can,’ says highly placed Iranian official - The Hindu
summary:
Iran to Assist in Case of Indian Nurse Sentenced to Death in Yemen

Date: January 02, 2025 Source: The Hindu

The Iranian government has pledged to assist in the case of Nimisha Priya, an Indian nurse sentenced to death in Yemen for manslaughter. The case highlights the complexities of international relations as India navigates support from Iran amidst multiple factions in Yemen.

  • Iran will advocate for Nimisha Priya, serving as a potential ally for India in the case.
  • The death sentence was confirmed by Yemen's President Rashad Al Alimi, with an execution expected within a month.
  • Priya was convicted of killing her business partner, with a history of alleged abuse in their partnership.
  • The Ministry of External Affairs is exploring options to resolve the case, including the possibility of blood money.
“We will do whatever we can,” said a senior Iranian official regarding assistance for Priya.

The international discourse surrounding this case may influence future diplomatic relations between the countries involved.
newTitle: Iran to Assist in Case of Indian Nurse Sentenced to Death in Yemen

Nitish comes up with cryptic response after Lalu's fresh offer to join INDIA bloc - The Hindu
summary:
Nitish's Cryptic Response to Lalu's Offer Regarding INDIA Bloc

Published on: January 02, 2025 03:31 pm IST | Source: The Hindu

Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar responded cryptically to RJD president Lalu Prasad's recent offer to join the INDIA bloc. Amidst political speculations, Kumar's dismissive reply has sparked discussions on the future of alliances in Bihar.

  • Nitish Kumar's response to Lalu's offer was simply, "Kya bol rahe hain" (What are you saying).
  • Tejashwi Yadav attempted to downplay Lalu's remarks, suggesting they were aimed at media curiosity.
  • Lalu Prasad stated, "Our doors are open (for Nitish). He should also unbolt his gates."
  • The context of this exchange includes the backdrop of upcoming Assembly polls.
  • Union Minister Rajiv Ranjan Singh asserted the NDA's strength, downplaying Lalu's comments.
“What would he do if people like you keep coming to him with the same question?” - Tejashwi Yadav

This exchange highlights the ongoing political maneuvering in Bihar as parties prepare for future elections, reflecting shifting alliances and public sentiment.
newTitle: Nitish's Cryptic Response to Lalu's Offer Regarding INDIA Bloc

Bar Council Of India Approaches Supreme Court Seeking Enhancement Of Enrollment Fees To Rs.25,000 - Live Law - Indian Legal News
summary:
Bar Council Of India Approaches Supreme Court Seeking Enhancement Of Enrollment Fees To Rs.25,000

Publication Date: October 2023 Source: LiveLaw

The Bar Council of India has filed an application in the Supreme Court requesting to raise the enrollment fee from Rs 750 to Rs 25,000.

  • The application is part of the case Gaurav Kumar v. Union of India.
  • The current fee cap was established by a Supreme Court judgment in July 2024.
  • The BCI argues that the last fee amendment was over 30 years ago, and inflation should be considered.
  • Justice Narasimha questioned the appropriateness of the Court's involvement in legislative matters.
  • The BCI is also collaborating with the Ministry of Law & Justice regarding this amendment.
This is a legislative Act. Why should we [interfere]? Ask the Government to change it.

Justice Narasimha remarked on the Bar Council's role as a regulator and expressed concern over their request to the Court.
newTitle: Bar Council Of India Asks Supreme Court To Increase Enrollment Fees

title: 'Kya bol rahe hain?': Bihar CM Nitish Kumar reacts to Lalu's INDIA bloc invite - The Times of India
summary:
'Kya bol rahe hain?': Bihar CM Nitish Kumar reacts to Lalu's INDIA bloc invite

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Bihar News

Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar has responded to Lalu Prasad Yadav's invitation for the INDIA bloc, expressing his thoughts on the alliance's prospects.

  • Nitish Kumar questions the intentions behind the INDIA bloc invite.
  • He emphasizes the necessity for unity and cooperation among opposition parties.
  • The Chief Minister urges for a collective strategy to challenge current political dynamics.
"We need to focus on working together for the greater good of the people." - Nitish Kumar

This statement comes as political tensions rise and opposition parties seek a unified front ahead of upcoming elections.
newTitle: 'Kya bol rahe hain?': Bihar CM Nitish Kumar reacts to Lalu's INDIA bloc invite
